## GAD-7 vs SHS

The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Subjective Happiness Scale (SHS) are two significant measures used in psychology and social sciences. Nonetheless, when it comes to comparing the efficacy and the results derived from them, it becomes quite challenging due to the different contexts and language frameworks. Hence, the task of 'GAD-7 vs SHS', though crucial, is also strenuous. Thankfully, Harmony, a software tool developed for psychologists, simplifies the comparison and harmonisation of these assessment tools using natural language processing and generative AI models.

## Empower Your Research: Employ Harmony for GAD-7 vs SHS

Harmony makes harmonisation of data collected with GAD-7 and SHS an achievable goal, improving the efficacy of analysis and study comparisons. Through Harmony, you can select and compare instruments from its extensive database or upload your own instruments in PDF format. It uses large language models to compare tools and give a percentage match between corresponding items in GAD-7 and SHS. This state-of-the-art technological intervention accelerates the process of cross-tool comparison and enhances the accuracy of findings.

## GAD-7 vs SHS: Multilingual Comparison Made Easy by Harmony

Harmony’s vast potential lies in its capability to perform comparisons of assessment tools in multiple languages. So, whether you’re handling an international cohort or comparing local studies using different languages, performing 'GAD-7 vs SHS' comparisons becomes a breeze with Harmony.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SHS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and SHS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SHS into Harmony</a> - compare SHS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
